instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..
definitions.GPUVCORE_EN: What is GPUVCORE_EN? GPUVCORE_EN enables GPU VCORE when it is high, a power rail necessary for the GPU to function so you can get an image on the screen. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video no backlight
threads.message:
Hello,
This board in good conditions, no liquid damage visible.
Green light on charger, fans run, chime,  USB activity on pendrive, but no display backlight and no video, no video also on external display.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12.57V
<SIGNAL>DP_MUX_EN</SIGNAL>=0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL>=0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>=3.36V
<SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>=0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>=3.36V
<SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL>=3.35V
<SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>=0V
<SIGNAL>PM_ALL_GPU_PGOOD</SIGNAL>=3.35V
<SIGNAL>GMUX_RESET_L</SIGNAL>=3.35V

I imagine the issue can be <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> or close to it, what can I check next?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video no backlight
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video no backlight
threads.message: Ok thanks, discrete GPU? Can I apply the trick of  hardware mod on the GMUX?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video no backlight
threads.message:
Disable GPU in BIOS, instead od tedious job bypassing GMUX.
Keep in mind, BIOS mod will not survive to PRAM reset.
Also <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR> MUST be removed before applying power, after BIOS mod.

GMUX flash is the fastest way; no need to take out the board from shell.
Is PRAM resistant, but does not control backlight from keyboard.

Tiresias GPUkiller is the best option.
